block.p: Jina Lee Choi, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Chang Hum Choi of Long Grove, Ill., was married yesterday to Lee Hung-Ming Hsu, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Kuang-Shen Hsu of North Potomac, Md. The Rev. Dr. Delayne H. Pauling performed the ceremony at First St. Paul's Evangelical Lutheran Church in Chicago.
The bride and bridegroom, both 30, graduated from Yale Law School, where they met.

Jina Lee Choi, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Chang Hum Choi of Long Grove, Ill., was married yesterday to Lee Hung-Ming Hsu, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Kuang-Shen Hsu of North Potomac, Md. The Rev. Dr. Delayne H. Pauling performed the ceremony at First St. Paul's Evangelical Lutheran Church in Chicago.
The bride and bridegroom, both 30, graduated from Yale Law School, where they met.

Ms. Choi, who is keeping her name, is a lawyer with the Justice Department in Washington, working in the civil rights division for the office of the special counsel. Next month, she is to join the San Francisco office of the Securities and Exchange Commission, becoming a lawyer in its enforcement division. She graduated from Oberlin College. Her father is the president of Foundation Engineering in Schaumburg, Ill.

Mr. Hsu is developing SFTrading.com, an online stock trading company in San Francisco. He graduated from Stanford University. His father is a hydrologist for the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration in Silver Spring, Md.
